markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Anugobu Wondercrafter](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1393)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Once an anugobu apprentice sets out on their own, they travel the world working on small projects here and there to maintain their skills. But an anugobu does not earn the honorable title of wondercrafter until they find their own wonder. Once they discover and finish such a wonder, the anugobu is considered fully mature. As a result of their station and experience, such anugobus possess skills and magic that far surpass most of their kind.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 25

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Anugobu_Wondercrafter.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 7">[Anugobu Wondercrafter](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1393)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="CN" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Tiny" />
<trait label="Anugobu" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=376" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=91" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island](/Sources.aspx?ID=85) pg. 81</row>

**Perception** +18; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23)

**Languages**
[Anugobu](/Languages.aspx?ID=85), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10), [Terran](/Languages.aspx?ID=22)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +17, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +12, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +20, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +15, [Engineering Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +20, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +17, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +14

<row gap="medium">
**Str** -1

**Dex** +4

**Con** +2

**Int** +6

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +4
</row>

**Items**
[sterling artisan tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 23 

**Fort** +13 

**Ref** +19 

**Will** +14 

</row>

**HP** 90

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet; stone step

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hammer +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 2d8+5 bludgeoning

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
chisel +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Parry](/Traits.aspx?ID=190), [versatile B](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 2d6+5 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
foot +16 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 2d4+7 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hammer +18 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 2d8+5 bludgeoning

**Occult Innate Spells** DC 25, attack +17
- **Cantrips (4th)**
[Prestidigitation](/Spells.aspx?ID=229), [Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334)
- **1st**
[Create Water](/Spells.aspx?ID=53), [Floating Disk](/Spells.aspx?ID=124), [Unseen Servant](/Spells.aspx?ID=352) (at will)
- **2nd**
[Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78)
- **3rd**
[Mending](/Spells.aspx?ID=189) (at will)
- **4th**
[Blink](/Spells.aspx?ID=27), [Creation](/Spells.aspx?ID=54) (at will)

**Planar Workshop**   An anugobu is intrinsically connected to small, pocket dimension that they typically refer to as their workshop. The workshop is an extradimensional 10-foot cube. The workshop holds an anugobu's collected tools and materials. An anugobu can enter or leave their planar workshop as an action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) and [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104) traits. The anugobu gains resistance 5 to all damage (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=75)) and concealment while within the workshop. The workshop is only visible while the anugobu is inside it.

**Stone Step**   An anugobu can effortlessly stick to any worked or manufactured surface, allowing them to walk up walls and stand on ceilings.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-284" />
name: Anugobu Wondercrafter
